pullRequest.title: [CDAP-12429][CDAP-17463] Wrangler: Warn about problems with column names
pullRequest.bodyText:
Jira: https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-12429
This adds a warning in DataPrepTable if the user enters a column name that contains invalid characters. There's no auto-fix option - clicking "Ok" will cancel the edit. This is based on feedback from the PM.

Jira: https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-17463
This removes the "Apply" button from the duplicate name warning, which wasn't working anymore anyway. Clicking "Ok" will cancel the edit.

This replaces #12892

beforeCommit.message: Per PM feedback, this removes the "Apply" from the warning message to remove the auto-fix option. "Ok" will cancel the edit.

afterCommit.message: [CDAP-12429] Wrangler: Give user feedback and an option to cancel when entering an invalid column name

beforeCommit.message: [CDAP-12429] Wrangler: Give user feedback and an option to cancel when entering an invalid column name

afterCommit.message:
[CDAP-12429][CDAP-17463] Wrangler: Updated warning messages for duplicate column name and invalid characters in name
CDAP-12429: Give warning for invalid characters instead of ignoring invalid inputs
CDAP-17463: A back-end change broke the Apply button for duplicate names. Remove Apply and only allow cancel from the wanring

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -411,6 +411,7 @@ features:
       dataErrorMessageTitle2: Unable to load data for "{workspaceName}".
       emptyWorkspace: No data
       noData: No data. Try removing some transformation steps.
+      invalidCharacterWarning: The name you have entered is invalid. It must contain only letters, numbers, and underscores (_). Pick a new name, or click "Ok" to cancel.

commit.message:
[CDAP-12429][CDAP-17463] Wrangler: Updated warning messages for duplicate column name and invalid characters in name
CDAP-12429: Give warning for invalid characters instead of ignoring invalid inputs
CDAP-17463: A back-end change broke the Apply button for duplicate names. Remove Apply and only allow cancel from the wanring
